thread.title: Arsenal would be unfair to sack Arsene Wenger…’he is a victim of his own success’
thread.title_full: Arsenal would be unfair to sack Arsene Wenger…’he is a victim of his own success’

author: gsweet
title: Arsenal would be unfair to sack Arsene Wenger…’he is a victim of his own success’
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ARSENAL legend Liam Brady insists that it would be very harsh were the club to sack Arsene Wenger. 
Irishman Brady claims Wenger is “a victim of his own success”. News Group Newspapers Ltd 6 Arsene Wenger …’victim of his own success’ 
Pressure on Wenger to quit has increased after the 5-1 defeat Champions League loss to Bayern Munich that virtually ended their interest in the competition at the first knockout round stage. 
It looks as though the Gunners will fail to get through the round of 16 for the seventh consecutive year. 
Wenger himself has revealed insisted he will be managing next season – but not necessarily at Arsenal. Sportsfile Liam Brady…was in charge of Arsenal’s youth set-up Theo Walcott signs Sutton players’ shirts in dressing room after Arsenal FA Cup win PA:Press Association 6 Brady in his playing heyday as a silky Arsenal midfielder 
It remains to be seen if he signs an extension to his Arsenal contract which expires this summer...or the board ask him to step aside after 21 years at the helm. Brady, 61, who directed the Arsenal’s youth set up between 1996 and 2014, says "to sack a manager with a record like [Wenger’s] would seem unfair" and warned the Frenchman’s detractors to remember what life was like before he arrived. Related Stories Chinese whispers Wayne Rooney's move to China may have to be approved by President Xi Jinping after crackdown on big-money transfers STAYING PUT Moussa Dembele to snub Chelsea, Arsenal and Real Madrid to see out four-year Celtic deal, according to agent Bon Appetit Chelsea and Manchester City ready to return for Leonardo Bonucci following his huge bust-up with boss Neym dropper Neymar spotted in London with Formula One star Lewis Hamilton and NFL ace Odell Beckham Jnr mad dog put down Martin Allen sacked by National League big-spenders Eastleigh after just two wins in 14 games in charge 
Wenger has qualified for the Champions League for the past 19 years and Brady said: “We competed maybe twice in the old European Cup, once under George Graham and once under Bertie Mee. 
“He’s a victim of his own success really. 
“Lots of fans have been brought up on the team he created. [Patrick] Vieira and [Emmanuel] Petit and they are craving those days again, but it’s easier said than done. Be careful what you wish for. PA:Press Association Food for thought...will Wenger go or will he stay? Sutton United 0-2 Arsenal : Sutton’s magical FA Cup run is ended in gritty encounter 
“You have to look at the financial clout of the clubs he’s competing against. In those [early] days, he wasn’t competing against a Chelsea with [Roman] Abramovich or a Man City with Abu Dhabi money. Even Tottenham were a poor shadow of what they are now. Liverpool have invested a lot of money. Man United are a money machine. 
“To keep the team consistently in the last 10 years in the top four, without having the money to spend… I know he’s spent money, but nothing compared to the likes of Chelsea, Man City and Man United have been able to afford, I think you have to take all that into consideration.” News Group Newspapers Ltd Some fans are in no doubt as to what should happen... News Group Newspapers Ltd 6 This message says it all from the anti-Wenger brigade 
Brady, speaking on Eamon Dunphy's podcast , added: “To sack a manager with a record like [Wenger’s] would seem unfair. 
“Some serious discussions are going to have to go on between Arsene and the principal owner Stan Kroenke and they’ve got to work it out between them whether Arsene is going to go on managing this club.”
